intro: Urceolina cuzcoensis, commonly known as the Cusco urn plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous areas. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Urceolina cuzcoensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
